γ THOMAS THE RHYMER.

THE feast was spread in Erchildoune, In Learmont’s high and ancient hall 3

And there were knights of great renown, And ladies laced in pall.

Nor lack'd they, while they sat at dine, The music nor the tale,

Nor goblets of the blood-red wine, Nor mantling quaighs of ale.

True Thomas rose, with harp in hand, When as the feast was done

(In minstrel strife‚ in F airy Land, The elfin harp he won).

Hush'd were the throng‚ both limb and tongue‚ And harpers for envy pale 3 ⁸ And armed lords lean'd on their swords, And listen'd to the tale.
